column5: Not even going to watch it.  Denmark really
They are a fast club. Enjoying it. Could be 3-2 not 3-0.

There was a transport truck fire that had the Niagara bound QEW closed at Bartlett here in Grimsby for hours before the game , bet a lot of fans missed the start of the game.  http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/hamilton/grimsby-qew-transport-truck-fire-1.4467450

Natasha Staniszewski from Sportcentre left at 10:45AM and got there in time for the overtime. I wonder how many other people got burned by that wreck? At least she got to watch the game on her cell while stuck in line at the border!!! https://www.bardown.com/sportscentre-s-natasha-staniszewski-hilariously-documented-her-traffic-filled-wjc-trek-to-buffalo-1.955513

When I saw the Casino Tour Bus go down my street I knew something was up, a few minutes later an alert was posted on the town facebook page that the town was gridlocked, a simple 10 minute trip to the LCBO was an hour plus

I did an interview and was on CP24 and then my best friends girlfriend who works for CTV did a live hit and was on the CTV national news...im the guy with the sunglasses on in the video and of course, rocking the nautilus survival suit! lollll  Dart guy was part of my 30 person group that headed down...nice guy. Took us 5 hours we made it in time for the first intermission and our tailgating plans got completed scrapped.
The boys are keeping them pined in the end. Wow. Fast, but yet a bit sloppy.
I'm watching at work.
Games over, back to work. LOL Next game will be a good one. Think the USA have it ?

I can't say that despite the score, Sweden didn't deserve the win. I think they outplayed Canada for the most part but Canada's goal late in the 3rd was the killer. If this was a best of 3 or best of 5, I'd be very concerned. Good on Canada for going hard right to the end. It paid off in gold.
I hope that Swedish captain gets a good talking to,  poor sport throwing his medal over the glass
I thought it was a great game!  Fast paced, lots of action.  Good skill and speed.  Great Golatending! Glad the boys pulled it off! Go Canada Go! Cheers!

As every year, I look forward to this tourny. I would think Canada and the USA have the easiest pool to finish 1st 2nd. Whom finishes where is up to them. I would love to see a CAN vs USA final. Atleast, the games are at times we all can watch. Now to find a live stream site that will showing them. GO CANADA GO

Not sure if it is the game you are referring to but heard on news this morning an outdoor junior game is cancelled in Ottawa because it is too cold .
It's all I have left lol

I don't follow the NHL any longer, that doesn't mean I don't like Hockey. I don't remember the exact year Copps Coliseum opened in the 80's, 86, 87 or 88 maybe, but I do know the first major event. Hamilton held the World Juniors. We took in at least  8 games including the final. I lived 3 blocks away. The Hammer was a rockin'.  If I'm not mistaken Canada won. Those guys are all retired old men now. What I do remember best was Shane Conlon.  He terrorized the Europeans and if I remember right Japan had a team in the tourney. There was a short little Japanese ref in the games and he could hardly skate. We razzed the Bejeezus out of the poor guy. The joke was I could skate better and  I couldn't skate for more than 5 minutes. That Conlon kid beat up anyone that dared skate on his ice and went after that Japanese ref when he gave him a game misconduct. A fight in international Hockey just didn't happen much back then unless between Canada and the USA. If the games weren't in Canada he would have been tossed from every game including that time when he chased this poor 5 foot nothing Japanese ref down the ice, he literally chased him. He should have been tossed for the entire tourney. Conlon came into a few bars downtown acting like Shane Conlon. He was lucky to get away virtually unharmed because he had to play. Good luck to Canada. Let's have a good clean tourney boys. Can't wait for the Canada/USA match up. Maybe not so clean for that one.
WOW, USA GOES DOWN 3-2 TO  SLOVAKIA
Can't wait for todays game too bad ticket sails suck hope they are better for todays game
HOLY MOLY!!!! Are these guys ever fast!!! It's like the video has been sped up!!! 45,000 tickets sold for today's game. Lots of peeps stuck in line at the border.

The year was 1986, Soviet Union won gold, Canada got silver.  There was nobody named 'Conlon' on the team but I think you may be thinking of Shane Corson?  If so he was a pretty decent hockey player with some grit.  I remember him playing with Rob Probert for the Brantford Alexanders back then and it was pretty entertaining to say the least!
